ol.li: The owner of the vehicle or his/her representative agrees that all valuable and personal items have been removed from the vehicle, and any personal valuables that remain in the vehicle shall only be the responsibility of the vehicle owner or his/her representative. EVS shall not be responsible for the loss or damage of any personal valuables left in the vehicle.

In case of an accident while the customer's vehicle is under EVS custody or on a road test, EVS's responsibility is limited only to repairing any damage resulting from any accident back to the condition in which the vehicle was received. The vehicle's owner or his/her representative accepts and waives the right to demand a replacement car or claim any compensation for losses resulting from any accidents.
Estimates for the cost of repairs are only valid if, in writing, the Customer authorizes EVS without delay and EVS agrees to undertake the work.

The estimates will cover only the items and labour explicitly stated in the estimate and do not cover the cost of any additional items that may be requested or required from either Party. The Customer consents that EVS may dismantle any part of the vehicle that may be required to effect the agreed repair or service work and hereby agrees to pay for the cost of the required dismantling and reassembly.
Estimated completion time is an approximate guide only and is stated entirely without obligation.

EVS agrees to warrant the repairs to the vehicle in line with the Manufacturer's Warranty terms and conditions. Parts purchased and fitted by EVS outside of any Vehicle Warranty scope will be warranted for a period of 3 months from the date of installation. Mechanical and Suspension parts are excluded. EVS will not warrant parts that have been fitted or tampered with outside of an EVS branch.

The company reserves the right to subcontract any or all of the agreed work. All parts replaced by EVS will be retained and disposed of by EVS, unless the Customer requests in writing at the time of vehicle handover to EVS to receive the replaced parts. In this case, the replaced parts must be collected at the time of vehicle collection. All parts replaced under the scope of a Manufacturer's or official EVS Warranty must be retained by EVS for warranty purposes.

The Customer hereby authorizes EVS to store the vehicle at EVS's or its Sub-contractors premises, at the Customer's risk, to test-drive, to drive the vehicle to and from EVS premises, and between EVS and EVS's sub-contractors premises.

Delivery and Collection of the vehicle should take place at EVS premises. Alternative arrangements must be agreed by an EVS Representative and may be undertaken at the exclusive risk of the Customer. All payments for work undertaken must be made at EVS premises.

The vehicle should be collected within two (2) days from the date of completion of the agreed work or a non-agreement on the repair estimate. Any delay beyond this point will incur a daily charge of AED100 charged every day, for vehicle storage as well as any additional expenses. Storage in this manner will be undertaken at the exclusive risk of the Customer.
